page.title: 19MERSTON AIRFIELD
page.content: During the war years 1941-1943 there was a great expansion in the operations of Tangmere Airfield. {Merston Airfield} was one of the six satellite landing grounds to be used when Tangmere Airfield came under heavy attack. 124 Squadron came to Merston from Lydd and New Romney for winter quarters in 1943/1944 - everything being transported by road. 247, 181 and 182 Squadrons also used Merston. The pilots and ground crews lived in Shopwyke, Drayton and Westbourne Houses, only using the Airfield for operations. Allied Airforce personnel were also housed in nearby North Mundham. The Airfield, disused for many years, is now agricultural land although the runways and some shelters can still be seen.
